_header: The great God full of grace
Title(s): ‘All way fond to say the Best’
_description: ‘All way fond to say the Best’ — ten 8-line stanzas

BlCottCalAII.First Lines:
The grete god full of graceof whom all goodnesse grew &
                    ganAnd all þat lestneth me a spacegod shylde hem fro þe fend
                    Satan…
BlCottCalAII.Last Lines:
…ffor goddes loue so full of graceAlwey fonde to say þe
                    best
BlCottCalAII.Note:
Written two lines of verse on each line of MS, with slash to mark line
                    breaks; ‘Explicit’ by scribe in lower margin, f. 68.
BlCottCalAII.Attributed Title:
All way fond to say þe best (by scribe, upper margin f. 68); Another
                    poeme intitled A way found to say the best (f. 1, sixteenth-century list of
                    contents)

PULGar143.First Lines:
The grete god so ful of graceof whom al godnes growe
                    ganne…
PULGar143.Last Lines:
…ffor godis loue so ful of graceAl way fond to say þe
                    best
PULGar143.Attributed Title:
Here begynneþ þe songe of saing þe best (f.
                    44v)
PULGar143.Editions:
Root,  Robert Kilburn. 
             “Poems from the Garrett MS.” 
             Englische Studien
         41 (1910): 360-79: 371-4.
Brown,  Carleton Fairchild,
                        ed.  
             Religious Lyrics of the XIV Century.
         Oxford: Clarendon, 1924. 2nd ed., rev.: G. V. Smithers, Oxford,
            1952: 191-3.
